title: Open Course on Energy Systems Analysis

yaml.title: Open Course on Energy Systems Analysis
yaml.description: Gang opens his Energy Systems Analysis class and hope the energy community find it resourceful.
yaml.author: Gang He

markdown.markdown:
{target="_blank"} ## Fundamental and Emerging Energy Topics - Lecture 1: [Introduction](https://drganghe.github.io/est603-energy-systems-analysis-2022-fall/lectures/lecture1/index.html){target="_blank"} - Lecture 2: [Make sense of energy numbers](https://drganghe.github.io/est603-energy-systems-analysis-2022-fall/lectures/lecture2/index.html){target="_blank"} - Lecture 3: [Energy systems overview](https://drganghe.github.io/est603-energy-systems-analysis-2022-fall/lectures/lecture3/index.html){target="_blank"} - Lecture 4: [Economics for energy systems analysis](https://drganghe.github.io/est603-energy-systems-analysis-2022-fall/lectures/lecture4/index.html){target="_blank"} - Lecture 5: [Energy sources](https://drganghe.github.io/est603-energy-systems-analysis-2022-fall/lectures/lecture5/index.html){target="_blank"} - Lecture 6: [Energy demand](https://drganghe.github.io/est603-energy-systems-analysis-2022-fall/lectures/lecture6/index.html){target="_blank"} - Lecture 7: [Energy, environment, and health](https://drganghe.github.io/est603-energy-systems-analysis-2022-fall/lectures/lecture7/index.html){target="_blank"} - Lecture 8: [Energy and climate change](https://drganghe.github.io/est603-energy-systems-analysis-2022-fall/lectures/lecture8/index.html){target="_blank"} - Lecture 9: [Power sector analysis](https://drganghe.github.io/est603-energy-systems-analysis-2022-fall/lectures/lecture9/index.html){target="_blank"} - Lecture 10: [Energy transition](https://drganghe.github.io/est603-energy-systems-analysis-2022-fall/lectures/lecture10/index.html){target="_blank"} - Lecture 11: [Energy efficiency, behavior, and sustainable consumption](https://drganghe.github.io/est603-energy-systems-analysis-2022-fall/lectures/lecture11/index.html){target="_blank"} - Lecture 12: [Energy poverty, access, and justice](https://drganghe.github.io/est603-energy-systems-analysis-2022-fall/lectures/lecture12/index.html){target="_blank"} - Lecture 13: [Big data and AI for clean energy](https://drganghe.github.io/est603-energy-systems-analysis-2022-fall/lectures/lecture13/index.html){target="_blank"} - Lecture 14: [Limitations of models](https://drganghe.github.io/est603-energy-systems-analysis-2022-fall/lectures/lecture14/index.html){target="_blank"} - Lecture 15: [Review and summary](https://drganghe.github.io/est603-energy-systems-analysis-2022-fall/lectures/lecture15/index.html){target="_blank"} ## Real-world Energy Assignments - HW0: [IRA emission reduction assessment](https://drganghe.github.io/est603-energy-systems-analysis-2022-fall/assignments/hw0.html){target="_blank"} - HW1: [Air quality in China and India](https://drganghe.github.io/est603-energy-systems-analysis-2022-fall/assignments/hw1.html){target="_blank"} - HW2: [Energy project economics](https://drganghe.github.io/est603-energy-systems-analysis-2022-fall/assignments/hw2.html){target="_blank"} - HW3: [Energy technology and impacts](https://drganghe.github.io/est603-energy-systems-analysis-2022-fall/assignments/hw3.html){target="_blank"} - HW4: [Load forecast, energy justice](https://drganghe.github.io/est603-energy-systems-analysis-2022-fall/assignments/hw4.html){target="_blank"} ## Social Media Posts ### LinkedIn ### Twitter

A semester's effort to open my "Energy Systems Analysis" class.

15 Lectures, covering overview, economics, technologies, climate, power, transition, efficiency, access, justice, AI and big data, limitations ...

5 Real-world assignments.

And more:https://t.co/hK3uM7tik5 https://t.co/enxLzoS3HE pic.twitter.com/1r88HtOBRW

— Gang He (@DrGangHe) December 13, 2022
Many students do not have access to high-quality learning material in energy and climate change, especially in the underserved communities. If you like this work, you can help those in need to access the open-source course by spreading the word. {{< include /files/includes/_socialshare.qmd >}}

metadata.description-meta: Samee Ullah is a Computational Structural Biologist and a former Bioinformatician at National Institute of Health. He studies the protein and nucleic acids structures, dynamics and interaction with small molecules using the state of the art methods of Molecular dynamics simulations, and physics based binding energy calculations.
